casebody.data:
STATE ex rel. UTILITIES COMN.
v.
CP&L. No. 649A03. Supreme Court of North Carolina. April 19, 2004. Gisele L. Rankin, Staff Attorney, for Public Staff. Leonard G. Green, Assistant Attorney General, for Roy Cooper. James P. West, Ralph McDonald, Raleigh, for Carolina Industrial Groups. Michael S. Colo, Rocky Mount, Thomas R. West, Raleigh, for Power Agency 1, Eastern Mun. Edward S. Finley, Jr., Len S. Anthony, Raleigh, Kodwo Ghartey-Tagoe, for CP&L, Duke Power, and Progress Energy. Robert B. Schwentker, Thomas K. Austin, Raleigh, for North Carolina Electric Membership Corp. Pamela A. Scott, Raleigh, for NCMPA #1 and NCEMPA.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 12th day of April 2004 by Edison Electric Institute for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). By order of the Court in conference this the 19th day of April 2004."

*815
